pros: Friendly, flexible, great location, beautiful campus
cons: Insurance not the best, but adequate

review_title: Great people, decent culture, so-so compensation
job_title: Assistant Director of Alumni and Parent Engagement in Naperville, IL
pros: Great vacation and leave benefits
cons: Burnout and compensation are issues

pros: The faculty at NCC are fantastic and the majority of people working at NCC are very friendly and easy to get along with. Being in a higher Ed setting is always unpredictable and fun. 100% Tuition remission for you and your dependents is fantastic.
cons: The administration is very disconnected from most of the campus. Your direct supervisor will determine how much you enjoy your time at NCC. My experience was negative as I had a poor supervisor that was very disconnected from my work, yet, also very much a micromanager.

review_title: Good but there could be improvements
pros: -A beautiful campus to work at -Good benefits -A new President is coming in, which will hopefully encourage more growth related to student and employee wellbeing.
cons: -Pay is not competitive -Senior leadership could be better at communicating and uplifting employees

pros: - flexible working environment, understanding from more senior athletic administrators and coaches, own office
cons: - stipend on the lower end of the spectrum

pros: Learning experience, great managers to work with

pros: Great support from direct supervisors, more vacation and sick time given than I could ever use in a year, flexible hours, beautiful campus, freedom to do my job the way I want to.
cons: Pay could be better, but it isn't terrible.

pros: The administration is very student focused - and they do a great job making every student feeling welcome.
cons: Some things are a little less organized compared to other institutions, but on the whole, it has been a great experience working there!

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Naperville, IL
pros: Good location. Close to Chicago. Very safe town.
cons: Salary range is okay, and working environment is not bad at all.

pros:
- Absolutely loved the people and culture there. They actually really do care about each individual in the office
- Made some lifelong friends during my time there
- Unbelievable work/life balance. Super understanding of this aspect
- Inclusive and very diverse
- Loved being so close to downtown Naperville. Very underrated aspect.
- Small campus feel but it's a tight-knit community
- Definitely my favorite place I've worked at
cons:
- The pay is way below the industry average which makes it difficult to want to stay
- Depending on the position, you might have some slow days and need to come up with ways to keep busy
- Meetings can run long and seem pointless at times

pros: Rooms could be worse and the food was decent
cons: overworked and looked at like you are privileged to be in such a position.

pros: Im just trying to use the website, but the school is good

pros: Was immediately set up with a 'mentor' who took me around, made appropriate introductions, and really helped me get a feel for the beautiful & historic campus. The spirit of the school extends well beyond the students and into the faculty and staff -- people really take pride in being there. Great benefits (health packages, tuition, etc.) and perks (Campus Coffee, discounted events, on-site medical, etc.) and a warm environment makes it a great place to work.
cons: Although the perks & benefits are great, the pay is low until you make it to management-level. As well, there are quite a bit of politics involved, and if you are not a favorite and/or in the "right department,' your career may not go anywhere.

job_title: Web Applications Developer in Naperville, IL
pros: Well-defined hours, good on-site amenities (gym, picturesque neighborhood, lots of local restaurants and shopping), generous retirement plan and tuition benefit
cons: IT manager spent much of each day instigating new, unproductive interpersonal conflicts within the department and with the management of other departments. Strong bias towards developing home-grown solutions to IT problems instead of using trusted third-party solutions. Little room for growth or advancement. Narrow perspective; management rarely considered adopting IT strategy or tactics except those used by local peer institutions. Poor base compensation.

job_title: Computer Lab Assistant in Naperville, IL
pros: The staff is extremely friendly. Everyone that you come across just brightens up your day even further. The workplace is such a calm place, you will never feel pressured or out of place.
cons: Since it is a small school, you won't come across lots of people when you're working, only occasionally. I would prefer to be around more people on a daily basis, but you can't have your cake and eat it too. The people that you work with are one of a kind, better than anyone can imagine.

pros: I could pick my own hours, since I was a student and had classes to work around. I never had to worry about working weekends or late at night, since the office was only open until 4pm, and only on weekdays. My supervisor was knowledgeable, very helpful and kind.
cons: The pay was minimum wage, and there wasn't opportunity to be promoted to earn more. There were not a lot of people working with me, so the work seemed harder sometimes simply having to do it all by myself.

pros: Benefits are pretty good, fun to interact with the students
cons: For the amount of work that's expected, the pay does not match up. We are at times spoken to like we are children and are treated like children. Our opinions don't matter. We are at times forced to do tasks that are unsafe and impractical. Our personal/family lives don't matter. As long as the job gets done, our lives and health don't matter. There is also a ton of favoritism. Some employees get to break the rules while some would get fired in a second if they did that.

pros: Awesome non-medical  benefits, nice work, life balance, people are friendly and welcoming. Discounts on sporting events, performances and college tuition.
cons: Because it is a not for profit, salaries are extremely low and medical expenses are on the higher side.  Work load is very heavy during certain times of the year

pros: I was able to pick the hours that I wanted, the workers and bosses were all very nice and friendly, I wasn't looked down on because I was new to the job, and direct deposit was mandatory so I didn't have to worry about picking up a paycheck.
cons: It was minimum wage, there wasn't an opportunity for growth as an employee, and sometimes there was too much downtime in the winter.

review_title: Only an on campus, part-time job
job_title: Language Resource Center Lab Assistant in Naperville, IL
pros: If you are taking any language class, you should work for the LRC.  It's fun, laidback, extremely easy, and your boss will be the nicest guy ever.  And you'll learn some practical work knowledge too, such as different programs the students will use, inventory experience, etc.
cons: It's hard to get the job unless you know someone already working there.

review_title: Great institution to get your feet wet!
pros:
Good environment for work life balance
Office culture is good (was better prior to last president leaving)
Benefits are typical
cons: Pay for the positions and area is extremely low in comparison to surrounding schools. Turnover has increased over the 6-9 months. Previously majority of staff stayed anywhere from 5-20+ years.

pros: Relaxed atmosphere, learn a lot of practical lab skills, helpful environment, flexible schedule. Lab manager really cares about safety and protocol.
cons: Student pay is minimum wage, student employment has no upward mobility and immediate benefits, but this isn't department specific.

job_title: Student In Accounting in Naperville, IL
pros: It is very convenient having a job on campus and it is very flexible to adjust the schedule according to your classes.
cons: It is paid minimum wage and it is limited to 29 hours per week. Also, it is the worst when some of the places (like for example the Business Office) don't let you do homework.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oak Park, IL
pros: North Central has been a wonderful place to work, great work environment, good leadership and great people. It also has great benefits for employees.
cons: The salary could be a little more competitive.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Naperville, IL
pros: Small, teaching focus, great people (mostly).
cons: Too much load and unrealistic expectations form the faculty. Compensation is not near where it should be given the high workload and the high cost of living in the Chicago area.

review_title: It's a Great Day to be a Cardinal!

cons: There are few changes I would make.

cons: Lower than average pay compared to other institutions in IL
